meanings.definition: A type of edible clam found along the Atlantic coast of North America.
meanings.sent1: We enjoyed a delicious meal of quahogs at the beach.
meanings.sent2: The quahogs were fresh and tasty in the seafood stew.
meanings.sent3: The seagull tried to steal a quahog from my bucket!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as loud as a quahog shell being opened.
meanings.sent5: The smell of the ocean mingled with the scent of quahogs cooking.

meanings.definition: The hard shell of a quahog clam, often used in jewelry or as a decorative item.
meanings.sent1: She collected colorful quahog shells to make a necklace.
meanings.sent2: The children painted the quahog shells to create beautiful art.
meanings.sent3: The sound of the waves echoed through the quahog shell.
meanings.sent4: His determination was as tough as a quahog shell.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight reflected off the iridescent quahog shell.

meanings.definition: To gather or harvest quahogs for consumption or other purposes.
meanings.sent1: We decided to quahog together for a seafood feast.
meanings.sent2: They quahogged all morning to fill the bucket with clams.
meanings.sent3: Let's quahog before the tide comes in and covers the beach!
meanings.sent4: The community came together to quahog for a charity event.
meanings.sent5: She quahogged with skill and speed, impressing everyone around.
